text: lievens provides Real-Time PCR Data Sets Lievens et al. (2012).

title: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Lievens et al. (2012)
Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Lievens et al. (2012)
text: sample group defined inhibitor (“none”, “isopropanol”, “tannic acid”), respective inhibitor concentration, initial amplicon copy number. Note inhibitor concentration initial copy number amplicon independent concentrations obtained co-dilution. number replicates per group:
code: library(lievens) library(ggplot2) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  lievens |>   dplyr::distinct(plate, inhibitor, inhibitor_conc, copies, dilution) #> # A tibble: 15 × 5 #>    plate           inhibitor   inhibitor_conc copies dilution #>    <fct>           <fct>                <dbl>  <int>    <int> #>  1 soy             none                0      100000        1 #>  2 soy             none                0       20000        5 #>  3 soy             none                0        4000       25 #>  4 soy             none                0         800      125 #>  5 soy             none                0         160      625 #>  6 soy+isopropanol isopropanol         2.5    100000        1 #>  7 soy+isopropanol isopropanol         0.5     20000        5 #>  8 soy+isopropanol isopropanol         0.1      4000       25 #>  9 soy+isopropanol isopropanol         0.02      800      125 #> 10 soy+isopropanol isopropanol         0.004     160      625 #> 11 soy+tannic acid tannic acid         0.2    100000        1 #> 12 soy+tannic acid tannic acid         0.04    20000        5 #> 13 soy+tannic acid tannic acid         0.008    4000       25 #> 14 soy+tannic acid tannic acid         0.0016    800      125 #> 15 soy+tannic acid tannic acid         0.0032    160      625 lievens |>   dplyr::distinct(plate, inhibitor, inhibitor_conc, copies, dilution, replicate) |>   dplyr::count(plate, inhibitor, inhibitor_conc, copies, dilution) |>   print(n = Inf) #> # A tibble: 15 × 6 #>    plate           inhibitor   inhibitor_conc copies dilution     n #>    <fct>           <fct>                <dbl>  <int>    <int> <int> #>  1 soy             none                0         160      625    18 #>  2 soy             none                0         800      125    18 #>  3 soy             none                0        4000       25    18 #>  4 soy             none                0       20000        5    18 #>  5 soy             none                0      100000        1    18 #>  6 soy+isopropanol isopropanol         0.004     160      625    18 #>  7 soy+isopropanol isopropanol         0.02      800      125    18 #>  8 soy+isopropanol isopropanol         0.1      4000       25    18 #>  9 soy+isopropanol isopropanol         0.5     20000        5    18 #> 10 soy+isopropanol isopropanol         2.5    100000        1    18 #> 11 soy+tannic acid tannic acid         0.0016    800      125    18 #> 12 soy+tannic acid tannic acid         0.0032    160      625    18 #> 13 soy+tannic acid tannic acid         0.008    4000       25    18 #> 14 soy+tannic acid tannic acid         0.04    20000        5    18 #> 15 soy+tannic acid tannic acid         0.2    100000        1    18

title: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Lievens et al. (2012)
text: concentrated set replicates dilution series 100,000 copies soybean Lectin endogene (Le1) derived amplicon. Following samples series five-fold dilutions.
code: lievens |>   dplyr::filter(inhibitor == "none") |>   ggplot(aes(x = cycle, y = fluor, group = interaction(plate, inhibitor, dilution, replicate), col = as.factor(dilution))) +   geom_line(linewidth = 0.1, alpha = 0.5) +   geom_point(size = 0.05, alpha = 0.5) +   labs(color = "Fold dilution") +   ylim(0, 12000)

title: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Lievens et al. (2012)
code: lievens |>   dplyr::filter(inhibitor == "isopropanol") |>   ggplot(aes(x = cycle, y = fluor, group = interaction(plate, inhibitor, inhibitor_conc, replicate), col = as.factor(inhibitor_conc))) +   geom_line(linewidth = 0.1, alpha = 0.5) +   geom_point(size = 0.05, alpha = 0.5) +   labs(color = "Isopropanol, % (v/v)") +   ylim(0, 12000)

title: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Lievens et al. (2012)
code: lievens |>   dplyr::filter(inhibitor == "tannic acid") |>   ggplot(aes(x = cycle, y = fluor, group = interaction(plate, inhibitor, inhibitor_conc, replicate), col = as.factor(inhibitor_conc))) +   geom_line(linewidth = 0.1, alpha = 0.5) +   geom_point(size = 0.05, alpha = 0.5) +   labs(color = "Tannic acid, mg/mL") +   ylim(0, 12000) #> Warning: Removed 74 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_line()`). #> Warning: Removed 74 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`).

what: lievens: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Lievens et al. (2012) — lievens-package
title: lievens: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Lievens et al. (2012) — lievens-package
text: Real-time quantitative polymerase chain reaction (qPCR) data sets Lievens et al. (2012) doi:10.1093/nar/gkr775 . Provides one single tabular tidy data set long format, encompassing three dilution series, targeted soybean Lectin endogene. dilution series assayed one following PCR-efficiency-modifying conditions: PCR inhibition, inhibition isopropanol inhibition tannic acid. inhibitors co-diluted along dilution series. co-dilution series consists five-point, five-fold serial dilution. concentration 18 replicates. amplification curve 60 cycles long. Original raw data file available Supplementary Data section Nucleic Acids Research Online doi:10.1093/nar/gkr775 .

title: lievens: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Lievens et al. (2012) — lievens-package
text: Maintainer: Ramiro Magno rmagno@pattern.institute (ORCID) contributors: Pattern Institute [copyright holder, funder]

what: qPCR data sets by Lievens et al. (2012) — lievens
title: qPCR data sets by Lievens et al. (2012) — lievens
text: One single tabular tidy data set long format, encompassing three data sets five-point, five-fold dilution series: () without inhibitor, (ii) isopropanol inhibition (iii) tannic acid inhibition. target amplicon consisted sequence within soybean Lectin endogene. Please read Methods section Lievens et al. (2012) experimental details. data set consists five-point, five-fold dilution series spanning amplicon copy number range \(100,000\) \(160\). concentration replicated 18 times. reaction amplified 60 cycles.

title: qPCR data sets by Lievens et al. (2012) — lievens
code: dplyr::filter(lievens, inhibitor == "none") #> # A tibble: 5,400 x 13 #>    plate well  target dye   inhibitor inhibitor_conc sample sample_type #>    <fct> <fct> <fct>  <fct> <fct>              <dbl> <fct>  <fct>       #>  1 soy   <NA>  Le1    SYBR  none                   0 S1     std         #>  2 soy   <NA>  Le1    SYBR  none                   0 S1     std         #>  3 soy   <NA>  Le1    SYBR  none                   0 S1     std         #>  4 soy   <NA>  Le1    SYBR  none                   0 S1     std         #>  5 soy   <NA>  Le1    SYBR  none                   0 S1     std         #>  6 soy   <NA>  Le1    SYBR  none                   0 S1     std         #>  7 soy   <NA>  Le1    SYBR  none                   0 S1     std         #>  8 soy   <NA>  Le1    SYBR  none                   0 S1     std         #>  9 soy   <NA>  Le1    SYBR  none                   0 S1     std         #> 10 soy   <NA>  Le1    SYBR  none                   0 S1     std         #> # i 5,390 more rows #> # i 5 more variables: replicate <fct>, copies <int>, dilution <int>, #> #   cycle <int>, fluor <dbl>

title: qPCR data sets by Lievens et al. (2012) — lievens
text: series reactions subjected inhibition isopropanol concentrations: 2.5, 0.5, 0.1, 0.02, 0.004 % (v/v). samples co-diluted, initial copy numbers target amplicon also follow five-fold progression tandem: 100,000, 20,000, 4,000, 800 160.
code: dplyr::filter(lievens, inhibitor == "isopropanol") #> # A tibble: 5,400 x 13 #>    plate          well  target dye   inhibitor inhibitor_conc sample sample_type #>    <fct>          <fct> <fct>  <fct> <fct>              <dbl> <fct>  <fct>       #>  1 soy+isopropan~ <NA>  Le1    SYBR  isopropa~            2.5 S1     std         #>  2 soy+isopropan~ <NA>  Le1    SYBR  isopropa~            2.5 S1     std         #>  3 soy+isopropan~ <NA>  Le1    SYBR  isopropa~            2.5 S1     std         #>  4 soy+isopropan~ <NA>  Le1    SYBR  isopropa~            2.5 S1     std         #>  5 soy+isopropan~ <NA>  Le1    SYBR  isopropa~            2.5 S1     std         #>  6 soy+isopropan~ <NA>  Le1    SYBR  isopropa~            2.5 S1     std         #>  7 soy+isopropan~ <NA>  Le1    SYBR  isopropa~            2.5 S1     std         #>  8 soy+isopropan~ <NA>  Le1    SYBR  isopropa~            2.5 S1     std         #>  9 soy+isopropan~ <NA>  Le1    SYBR  isopropa~            2.5 S1     std         #> 10 soy+isopropan~ <NA>  Le1    SYBR  isopropa~            2.5 S1     std         #> # i 5,390 more rows #> # i 5 more variables: replicate <fct>, copies <int>, dilution <int>, #> #   cycle <int>, fluor <dbl>

title: qPCR data sets by Lievens et al. (2012) — lievens
text: series reactions subjected inhibition tannic acid concentrations: 0.2, 0.04, 0.008, 0.0016 0.0032. samples co-diluted, initial copy numbers target amplicon also follow five-fold progression tandem: 100,000, 20,000, 4,000, 800 160.
code: dplyr::filter(lievens, inhibitor == "tannic acid") #> # A tibble: 5,400 x 13 #>    plate          well  target dye   inhibitor inhibitor_conc sample sample_type #>    <fct>          <fct> <fct>  <fct> <fct>              <dbl> <fct>  <fct>       #>  1 soy+tannic ac~ <NA>  Le1    SYBR  tannic a~            0.2 S1     std         #>  2 soy+tannic ac~ <NA>  Le1    SYBR  tannic a~            0.2 S1     std         #>  3 soy+tannic ac~ <NA>  Le1    SYBR  tannic a~            0.2 S1     std         #>  4 soy+tannic ac~ <NA>  Le1    SYBR  tannic a~            0.2 S1     std         #>  5 soy+tannic ac~ <NA>  Le1    SYBR  tannic a~            0.2 S1     std         #>  6 soy+tannic ac~ <NA>  Le1    SYBR  tannic a~            0.2 S1     std         #>  7 soy+tannic ac~ <NA>  Le1    SYBR  tannic a~            0.2 S1     std         #>  8 soy+tannic ac~ <NA>  Le1    SYBR  tannic a~            0.2 S1     std         #>  9 soy+tannic ac~ <NA>  Le1    SYBR  tannic a~            0.2 S1     std         #> 10 soy+tannic ac~ <NA>  Le1    SYBR  tannic a~            0.2 S1     std         #> # i 5,390 more rows #> # i 5 more variables: replicate <fct>, copies <int>, dilution <int>, #> #   cycle <int>, fluor <dbl>

title: qPCR data sets by Lievens et al. (2012) — lievens
text: tibble providing amplification curve data long format. row amplification curve point. plate Plate identifier. one identifier four data sets. well Well identifier, .e. position within PCR plate. information available original publication, thus values NA. target Target identifier. data sets target amplicon consisting soybean Lectin endogene "Le1". dye Type fluorescence dye, data set always SYBR Green master mix (Roche) ("SYBR"). inhibitor Name molecule used PCR inhibitor. case dilution series value "none". inhibitor_conc Inhibitor concentration mg/mL. sample Name biological sample. Samples simple consecutive identifier: S1, S2, ..., S5. sample_type Sample type. reactions standard curves, .e. "std". replicate Replicate identifier. copies Standard copy number amplicon. dilution Dilution factor. Higher number means greater dilution, e.g. 5 means 1:5 (five-fold) dilution relative concentrated standard. cycle PCR cycle. fluor Raw fluorescence values.

title: qPCR data sets by Lievens et al. (2012) — lievens
qPCR data sets by Lievens et al. (2012) — lievens
code: lievens #> # A tibble: 16,200 × 13 #>    plate well  target dye   inhibitor inhibitor_conc sample sample_type #>    <fct> <fct> <fct>  <fct> <fct>              <dbl> <fct>  <fct>       #>  1 soy   NA    Le1    SYBR  none                   0 S1     std         #>  2 soy   NA    Le1    SYBR  none                   0 S1     std         #>  3 soy   NA    Le1    SYBR  none                   0 S1     std         #>  4 soy   NA    Le1    SYBR  none                   0 S1     std         #>  5 soy   NA    Le1    SYBR  none                   0 S1     std         #>  6 soy   NA    Le1    SYBR  none                   0 S1     std         #>  7 soy   NA    Le1    SYBR  none                   0 S1     std         #>  8 soy   NA    Le1    SYBR  none                   0 S1     std         #>  9 soy   NA    Le1    SYBR  none                   0 S1     std         #> 10 soy   NA    Le1    SYBR  none                   0 S1     std         #> # ℹ 16,190 more rows #> # ℹ 5 more variables: replicate <fct>, copies <int>, dilution <int>, #> #   cycle <int>, fluor <dbl>
